member.name: M:Novartis.Msi.Core.Util.NearEqual(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Compares two double values for equality with default tolerance.
member.remarks: Compares double values for equality, taking into consideration that floating point values should never be directly compared using ==. 2 doubles could be conceptually equal, but vary by a .0000001 which would fail in a direct comparison. To circumvent that, a tolerance value is used to see if the difference between the 2 doubles is less than the desired amount of accuracy.

member.remarks: Compares double values for equality, taking into consideration that floating point values should never be directly compared using ==. 2 doubles could be conceptually equal, but vary by a .0000001 which would fail in a direct comparison. To circumvent that, a tolerance value is used to see if the difference between the 2 doubles is less than the desired amount of accuracy.

member.name: M:Novartis.Msi.Core.Util.ParseCommandLine(System.String[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Transform the command line string array into a Dictionary.
member.param: The string array, usually string[] args from your main function
Ignore the case of arguments? (if set to false, then "/beta" and "/Beta" are two different arguments)
Allow multiple parameters to one argument.
member.returns: A Dictionary where the arguments are the keys and parameters to the arguments are in a List. Keep in mind that the List may be null!
member.remarks: If allowMultipleParameters is set to true, then "/delta omega kappa" will cause omega and kappa to be two parameters to the argument delta. If allowMultipleParameters is set to false, then omega will be a parameter to delta, but kappa will be assigned to string.Empty.

member.name: M:Novartis.Msi.Core.ViewImage.CalculatePointsInRoi
member.summary: Calculates are the Points inside ROI We will create a temporary Canvas and draw the ROI Polygon onto it (Canvas is white, polygon is black) Steps:- 1) Create a canvas in memory, with a white background 2) Make a bitmap image of this canvas - save it to memory (file) 3) Generate a bitmap of that canvas 4) Iterate through the bitmap and find the position of all black pixels - store them 5) Calculate the NumberOfPointsInsideRoi 6) Clean up objects

member.name: M:Novartis.Msi.Core.ViewImage.FixRoi
member.summary: Fixes the ROI and does various bits of processing Step 1 Check to see if regionofinterest is closed. If it isn't close it. Step 2 Create a polygon for the area around Step 3 Disable the Roithumbs - so they can't be moved. Step 4 Find all points inside of the polygon and save them to pointsInsideRoi Step 5 Copy currentselectedroithumbs into ThumbPositions Step 6 Calculate the area of the ROI Step 7 Calculate the MeanIntensity of the ROI Step 8 Copy the contents of regionofinterest Objects to the List of ROI Objects for this view Step 9 Enable Menus Step 10 Clean up Local ROI objects

member.param: Region of Interest who's area we want to calculate
member.returns: returns the area of the regionofinterest

member.summary: This method calculates the mean intensity in the currentroi and updates the currentroi with the mean intensity value

member.name: M:Novartis.Msi.Core.ViewImage.SetContextMenuStatus
member.summary: This routine enables and disable the context menu's depending on the status off the view 1) mnuNew.items: Check to see which polygons exist in the view. Disable all menu options which have valid polygons Enable ones which don't have valid polygons. ** Note Can ONLY have one polygon per ROI ** 2) mnuFix, mnuClose: If there is a Open of closed path enable otherwise disable 3) mnuDelete: If there is a currentselectedroipolygon or currentselectedroiobject enable Otherwise disable 4) mnuEdit: If we have a currently selected polygon enable the Edit menu, otherwise disable 5) mnuViewRoiData: If there are 'any' polygons on the current view enable mnuViewRoiData, otherwise disable
